item.title: Marie add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "It was time to take the pumpkin out of the pot and eat it. In the final analysis, that was what solved these big problems of life. You could think and think and get nowhere, but you still had to eat your pumpkin. That brought you down to earth. That gave you a reason for going on. Pumpkin." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Marie add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Behind every man now alive stand thirty ghosts, for that is the ratio by which the dead outnumber the living." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Marie add a quote by Georgette Heyer
item.description: "Randall laid his hand on Stella's, but only to remove it from his sleeve. "My precious, you really must have some regard for my clothes," he said with gentle reproach. "Much as I love you, I cannot permit you to maul this particular coat." -- Georgette Heyer

item.title: Marie add a quote by Lynne Truss
item.description: "I think about death sometimes. Analytically, of course." -- Lynne Truss

item.title: Marie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Now when I had mastered the language of this water, and had come to know every trifling feature that bordered the great river as familiarly as I knew the letters of the alphabet, I had made a valuable acquisition. But I had lost something, too. I had lost something which could never be restored me while I lived. All the grace, the beauty, the poetry, had gone out of the majestic river!" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marie add a quote by Lynne Truss
item.description: "No valentines from the cats again." -- Lynne Truss

item.title: Marie add a quote by Elizabeth Kostova
item.description: "You are a total stranger and you want to take my library book." -- Elizabeth Kostova

item.title: Marie add a quote by Monty Python
item.description: "You see, I don't belive that libraries should be drab places where people sit in silence, that has been the main reason for our policy of employing wild animals as librarians." -- Monty Python

item.title: Marie add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I write this sitting in the kitchen sink." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Marie add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "Well, it all comes to this; there's no use trying to live in other people's opinions. The only thing to do is to live in your own. After all, I believe in myself. I'm not so bad and silly as they think me, and I'm not consumptive, and I <i>can</i> write. Now that I've written it all out I feel differently about it. The only thing that still aggravates me is that Miss Potter pitied me -- pitied by a Potter!" -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Marie add a quote by Bliss Carman
item.description: "On the shining yards of heaven See a wider dawn unfurled. . . . The eternal slaves of beauty Are the masters of the world." -- Bliss Carman

item.title: Marie add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "Why did dusk and fir-scent and the afterglow of autumnal sunsets make people say absurd things?" -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Marie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, â€œLook, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Marie add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "He was a secret agent, and still alive thanks to his exact attention to the detail of his profession." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Marie add a quote by Len Deighton
item.description: "When they ask me to become president of the United States I'm going to say, "Except for Washington D.C." -- Len Deighton

item.title: Marie add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "... I wanted Ambiades to understand that I considered myself a hierarchy of one." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Marie add a quote by Scott Douglas
item.description: "There was the smell of old books, a smell that has a way of making all libraries seem the same. Some say that smell is asbestos. " -- Scott Douglas

item.title: Marie add a quote by Scott Douglas
item.description: "I am convinced that grandkids are inherently evil people who tell their grandparents to "just go to the library and open up an e-mail account - it's free and so simple." -- Scott Douglas

item.title: Marie add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Marie add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Marie add a quote by Pat Mora
item.description: "I did realize, as do you, how blessed I was to know bookjoy, the private pleasure of savoring text." -- Pat Mora

item.title: Marie add a quote by Thomas Cahill
item.description: "Is is seldom possible to say of the medievals that they *always* did one thing and *never* another; they were marvelously inconsistent. " -- Thomas Cahill

item.title: Marie add a quote by Esme Raji Codell
item.description: "I tend not to share things unnecessarily with those I despise." -- Esme Raji Codell

item.title: Marie add a quote by Winifred Gallagher
item.description: "...In Jack Nasar's research on American's taste in homes, only one group preferred the modernist house: architects." -- Winifred Gallagher

item.title: Marie add a quote by Douglas Wilson
item.description: "Education is the process of selling someone on books. " -- Douglas Wilson

item.title: Marie add a quote by Anna Godbersen
item.description: "There was no pleasure like being envied on a mass scale." -- Anna Godbersen

item.title: Marie add a quote by Anna Godbersen
item.description: "They were a society whose chief vocations were to entertain and be entertained ..." -- Anna Godbersen

item.title: Marie add a quote by Anna Godbersen
item.description: "As she always did on any really important day, Penelope Hayes wore red." -- Anna Godbersen

item.title: Marie add a quote by Anna Godbersen
item.description: "Oh yes, well, I find myself unconventional everywhere." -- Anna Godbersen

item.title: Marie add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Roses are for love. Not silly sweet-hearts' love but the love that makes you and keeps you whole, love that gets you through the worst your life'll give you and that pours out of you when you're given the best instead." -- Robin McKinley
